p: In a comparative study of 18 different EOs from Madagascar [ 71], it was found that nine components were present with relatively high content, although with important variations in percentages. The compounds were limonene (3.6–11.0%), ( Z)-β-ocimene (1.0–17.1%), ( E)-β-ocimene (0.5–14.6%), p-cymene (0.3–20.4%), β-caryophyllene (1.1–12.7%), ( Z)-tagetenone (traces (tr)–26.7%), ( E)-tagetenone (tr–31.3%), α-muurolene (tr–36.5%), and verbenone (1.4–15.4%).
